required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study Examing The Effect of Grapefruit Juice On The Blood And Urine Samples of Study Drug And Its By Product And Safety
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 1, Open Label, Randomized, Fixed Sequence Study To Evaluate The Effect Of Multiple Dose Administration Of Grapefruit Juice On The Multiple Dose Pharmacokinetics Of CP-945,598 In Healthy Overweight And Obese Subjects

brief_summary.textblock: CP-945,598 is eliminated primarily by enzyme CYP3A. Grapefruit juice may affect the activity of CYP3A and alter the amount of CP-945,598 in the blood. This study will therefore compare the time course of drug concentrations in the body, safety and tolerability of CP-945,598 given with or without grapefruit juice in healthy obese/overweight subjects.

primary_outcome.measure: Measurement of durg and metabolite concentrations in serum from blood sampling collected at various times over 24 hours dosing interval on Day 7 and 21, before dosing on days 5,6, 12, 13, 14, 19 and 20.
Safetey laboratory tests (chemistry, hematology, urinalysis) on Days -1 and 22
Adverse event monitoring throughout duration of the study

intervention.description: Subjects take CP-945,598 alone for 21 days
Subjects take CP-945,598 from Days 1 to 7, then take CP-945,598 and Grapefruit Juice from Days 8 to 21

link.description: To obtain contact information for a study center near you, click here.
